entry.title: Field Level Infotype Update with Business Integration Builder
entry.content:
Business Problem

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) serves as the system of record for core HR data, including the attributes necessary to manage an employee’s lifecycle processes, such as hiring, changes in job and personal information, and more. In contrast, the payroll system is responsible for managing compliance-related data, including tax details, social insurance information, garnishments, and other statutory or regulatory requirements.

Employee data maintained in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central is replicated to the relevant Infotypes in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA. A single Infotype could have some fields being replicated form Employee central and a few payroll relevant fields that are not captured in Employee Central. Previously if such payroll relevant data was manually entered in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA for fields belonging to an Infotype which is replicated from Employee Central, then manual entries was overwritten the next time data was replicated from Employee Central. 

Let’s take an example with Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements). Contract Type (CTTYP) field of Infotype 0016 is available in Employee Central whereas payroll relevant fields Sick Pay Supplement Period Number (KGZFR) and Sick Pay Supplement Period Unit (KGZZH) missing in Employee Central is maintained in SAP S/4 HANA. 

Consider the following sequence of actions :-

  1. Hire an employee in Germany effective January 1, 2024, assigning Contract Type as Permanent.                                                                                                                                                                                               
  2. After replication, enter the following values directly into Infotype 0016 in the Payroll system (PA30 or Infotype UI mashups):
    • Sick Pay Supplement Period Number: 3
    • Sick Pay Supplement Period Unit: months                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
  3. Update the employee’s contract type to Part-time in EC by creating a new record in Job Information, effective from June 1, 2024.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
  4. After the next replication:
    • A new time slice is created in Infotype 0016, effective from June 1, 2024, with the Contract Type updated to Part-time.
    • The existing values of KGZFR and KGZFH fields in Infotype 0016 are cleared out both in the existing time-slice on January 1, 2024 and in the new record created on June 1, 2024.

As a result, customers often had to exclude such Infotypes from their replication scope and maintain them completely in the backend Payroll system either by using SAP GUI transactions or UI mashups. With this approach customers were unable to use the full flexibility of Employee Central as the modern cloud based HR system.

Field Level Infotype Update : Solution Overview

Employee master data replication from Employee Central using Business Integration Builder (BIB) now supports Field-Level Infotype Updates, enabling the partial replication of Infotype data from Employee Central without overwriting payroll-relevant Infotype fields maintained in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA.

Due to this newly introduced flexibility in master data replication, the data cut can now be configured at Infotype field level. You can now use Employee Central to maintain data of the available fields while entering the missing payroll-relevant fields of that infotype in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4HANA, either by using SAP GUI transactions or infotype UI mashups. The replication preserves existing payroll-related data, merges it with the incoming data from Employee Central, and updates the infotype with the combined details. 

In the same scenario described above, when contract type is updated from Permanent to Part Time in Employee Central and the Sick Pay Supplement Period details already exist in SAP S/4HANA, the outcome after replication is as follows :-

    • A new time slice is created in Infotype 0016, effective from June 1, 2024, with the Contract Type updated to Part-time.                                      
    • The existing values of KGZFR and KGZFH fields are retained in the existing time-slice and carry forwarded to the new time-slice effective from June 1, 2024.

The following visual illustrates how BIB replication works now with Field Level Infotype Update :-

Key Benefits

  • Maximize Cloud Capabilities: Extend your cloud footprint by leveraging the full potential of Employee Central as the core HR system of record.
  • Reduce Operational Costs  : Avoid embedding complex business logic or unnecessary custom fields in Employee Central for data that belongs to Payroll domain and not relevant for running core HR business processes.
  • Establish Role-Based Data Governance : Establish clear boundaries between HR and Payroll teams, allowing each to manage data relevant to their domain, improving governance and operational efficiency.
  • Seamless Data Continuity During Payroll System Upgrade : A consistent data cut between Core HR and Payroll ensures a smooth and reliable transition from SAP ERP HCM to SAP S/4 HANA on-premise or SAP S/4 HANA Private Cloud Edition.

Solution Status and Scope for 2H 2025

This feature of partial replication with field level Infotype update generally available with 2H 2025 release in :-

  • Support Package 40 of SFSF EC INTEGRATION (PA_SE_IN) add-on
  • Support Package 06 of SFSF EC S4 HCM INTEGRATION (ECS4HCM) add-on

For more details, refer to the What's New Viewer, ECS4HCM Help Guide, PA_SE_IN Help Guide.

The payroll relevant fields can now be protected during replication for the following Infotypes and their corresponding secondary Infotypes :-

  • Infotype 0001 (Organizational Assignment)
  • Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements)

This feature is intended for customers running payroll in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4HANA who are either beginning their Employee Central implementation or have already implemented it and want to broaden its usage scope.

To preserve historical Infotype data maintained in SAP ERP HCM or SAP S/4 HANA, it is recommended to use Field Level Infotype Update in combination with Infotype Specific Full Transmission Start Date functionality that is also introduced in 2H 2025.

Configuration Requirements

  • Set the constant value of EC to ERP: Don't overwrite Payroll related Infotype fields option in view  V_ECPAO_CONSTANTS to X.
  • Define the payroll-relevant fields of Infotype 0001 (Org Assignment) and Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements) that should be protected during employee master data replication from Employee Central, using the view ECPAO_INFTY_FLD available under Customizing for Business Integration Builder as shown below :-                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

The below configuration ensures that fields KGZFR (Sick Pay Supplement Period Number) and KGZZH (Sick Pay Supplement Period Unit) are protected during replication for employees belonging to Germany.

Subtypes and Country Grouping fields are optional. If a particular field is relevant for all countries, then this should be empty.

Fields belonging to Custom Includes can be included in this customizing for Field Level Infotype Update and protected during replication.

If an Infotype field is already mapped in the Transformation Template Group used for employee data replication, it should not be included in the Field-Level Infotype Update configuration. Doing so will cause replication errors due to data conflicts.

Additionally, it is recommended to exclude Infotype fields that are derived by the HCM Framework.

Conclusion: 

We truly value your feedback on this new functionality and would love to hear your thoughts on which additional Infotypes you would like to see supported, beyond Infotype 0001 (Organizational Assignment) and Infotype 0016 (Contract Elements).

Please feel free to share your suggestions, requirements, or expectations in the comments section. Your input plays a key role in shaping future enhancements, and we look forward to collaborating with you to improve our solution.

entry.title: Beyond Manual: SuccessFactors Custom MDF & Integration Center for Automated Reimbursement Process
entry.content:
Symptoms:
 In mid-to-large sized companies, HR officers often face a lot of challenges managing the reimbursement Requests raised each month. This process can become time consuming and labor intensive due to the variety of request types and calculation rules (business travel, visa charges…).
commonly these requests are submitted by email. After that the approval and the data entry into the payroll system will be performed manually. However, this will always lead to delayed payments and increased errors.
Process flow:

 


                                                                                                                             

Concept:
For a smoother and streamlined process, we must implement a fully automated solution, consider implementing a custom MDF object within SuccessFactors for each reimbursement category, for centralized payments governance.
 Yet, this solution will only cover Step 1 and 2 of the process flow. ⚠️

Limitations:
Data circulation from custom MDF objects to the standard SuccessFactors objects, is not supported using business rules (refer to SAP KBA 2562069 for details).

✅Standards to Custom MDF => Data propagation allowed via Business Rules
❌Custom MDF to Standards => Data propagation NOT allowed via Business Rules

Enhancement:
To cover the last step of the process flow (posting payments to payroll) and further enable full automation. We need to create an internal Integration Job using the SuccessFactors Integration Center (IC).

In the following section, we will guide you through the exact IC configuration steps.

How to map?

Search Integration Center, My Integrations => Create => More Integration Types.

 


To fill data into One-Time Payments (which is standard portlet), use a scheduled Integration Center job. Then Select all required fields, as framed in the screenshot below.

1.Select the Data Source: (Custom MDF object)
Search for your cust_MDF => Select

2.Select the Target object: (Standard Object)
Click Add Button

Search the Target MDF object (Non-Recurring Payments) => Select the destination Fields one after the other.

From the right corner, choose the mapping type for the fields(based on your need):

  • Set as Fixed Value Field: Used to Give fixed value to the destination field (e.g. Fixed payment type or currency).
  • Set as Association Field: Used to Directly get data from your Source Object. Drag the source field and drop it into the desired Target Field (e.g. The Total payment amount, the creation date…).
  • Set as Calculation Field: Used to Dynamically fill Data into the Target field based on data from 1 or more Source Fields. (e.g. generation of payment amounts using predefined formula rather than direct mapping).

3.Add filters and sorts: (Optional But Important⚠️)

First, we need to understand what are the different types of filters that we have:
a. Advanced Filters: Used to specify more complex conditional expressions than are  possible with the simple filters.
b. Time-Based Filters: Helps to get all the records (current and/or historical) that have been modified since the last time the integration ran.
c. Advanced Sorting: Used to sort the output records.”
 Source(https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/using-integration-center/filter-and-sort)
In our case will need to apply Time-Based Filter=>"Effective From Date", because we need to read and propagate all New, Old, and/or Changed records, not just the latest one.
(for more details please refer to KBA 2470903)

Important Note: ⚠️⚠️
If approved records only need to be Auto-created under one-time payment, please ensure to enable the pending Data fields in your Source Object definition:
 1. Access "Configure Object Definitions.

 2. Search for your Source Cust-MDF object.

 3. set the "Pending Data field" to YES

This way we ensure that the Integration will consider the requests with Approved Status only.

4. Schedule your Integration, then review and save.


By reaching this stage, we have successfully implemented a fully automated reimbursement Process .

5. Reporting: (Optional But Important⚠️)

To verify and track data it’s recommended to create two reports using the report center:
 1. Reimbursement Requests per Type
 2. Non-Recurring payment amounts per Reimbursement type.

Conclusion:
Combining Custom MDF Objects with SuccessFactors Integration center can serve the organizations’ needs to overcome the Business rule limitation and fully automate the Data propagation from Custom to Standard Objects. This can be achieved with Simple Configuration steps Starting By creating new Integration type, Selecting the Source object (Custom MDF), Choosing the Target object (Standard MDF), then configuring the appropriate Field mapping (Fixed, association, or calculated), Optionally applying Filters and Sorting (Advanced, Time-based, …), and Finally Schedule the Job to run at your preferred Frequency. 

References:

2701195 - SuccessFactors to SuccessFactors integration - Integration Center
2655688 - How to Set a Schedule for Integration Center Jobs Using SuccessFactors Integration Center

2742107 - Integration Center: Frequently Asked Questions
